intro: Cirrhopetalum baucoense, commonly known as the Bauco orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Dominica. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), while its roots are fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
